reviews.text: Lovely, sedate and relaxing - plenty is lovely scenery, a few places to eat and there's a good sized hotel and caravan/camping ground in addition to the castle (admission priced) all here in the heart of the Highlands

The old station survives but it is so sad it is not really in use any longer. There is no ticket office or toilet facilities, the original entrance is bricked up. The train journey from Blair Atholl to Inverness is just amazing so much beautiful scenery.
Nice wee station but no real facilities. Near the Blair castle.

Terrible. 

Tour was awful. Shop was very overpriced, the same bottlings can be purchased in supermarkets or online for much cheaper, giving absolutely no incentive to buy from the distillery.

If you're in the area, get yourself to the Famous Grouse Experience, or better yet, Edradour.
